theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on immune system remodeling, immunosenescence, and chronic low-grade inflammation as drivers of aging and age-related morbidity.
Emphasizes immunosenescence, immune remodeling, and chronic inflammation as central to inflammaging and aging-related diseases.

Centers on macrophage chronic activation, immune remodeling, and genetic/environmental interplay in inflammaging.
Describes inflammaging arising from oxidative stress, immunosenescence, autophagy decline, DNA damage, and cellular senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: PRR-Mediated Inflammaging and Neurovascular Dysfunction Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on pattern recognition receptor activation by DAMPs in neurovascular unit cells driving inflammaging and brain aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Resolution Failure and Macrophage Dysfunction Inflammaging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on impaired resolution of inflammation, defective efferocytosis, macrophage polarization defects, and reduced pro-resolving mediators.
